channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-3267] Swagger module does not produce a "models" section consistently when several modules are deployed
item.description:
This bug is a continuation of bugs ENTESB-3005 and ENTESB-2411. These bugs concerned problems in the Swagger module: the api-docs output was correct only for the first module whose api-docs/ URL was requested, and no "models" section appeared in the JSON output.

Test fixes attached to these two bugs (three JARs in total) fix these two bugs separately, but do not fix them together. That is, the "models" section is generated, but only for the first module requested. Other modules do not get a "models" section when api-docs/ is requested.

This is not (so far as I know) a fault in the application code because, whichever module I request first after starting Fuse, that module gets a "models" section, and the other never does. Repeating the requests does not change anything.
item.environment: JBoss Fuse 6.1.0 GA with various Swagger-related fixes
item.summary: Swagger module does not produce a "models" section consistently when several modules are deployed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
For the record, here is the output I get:

http://localhost:8181/cxf/rest/api-docs/restcustomer

{"apiVersion":"1.0.0","swaggerVersion":"1.2","basePath":"/rest/api-docs","resourcePath":"/restcustomer","apis":[{"path":"/restcustomer/customers/{id}/","operations":[{"method":"GET","summary":"Find Customer by ID","notes":"More notes about this method (rest)","type":"Customer","nickname":"getCustomer","produces":["application/xml"],"authorizations":{},"parameters":[{"name":"id","description":"ID of Customer to fetch","required":true,"type":"string","paramType":"path"}],"responseMessages":[{"code":500,"message":"Invalid ID supplied"},{"code":204,"message":"Customer not found"}]}]}],"models":{"Customer":{"id":"Customer","properties":{"id":{"type":"integer","format":"int64"},"name":{"type":"string"}}}}}

http://localhost:8181/cxf/rest2/api-docs/resttwocustomer

{"apiVersion":"1.0.0","swaggerVersion":"1.2","basePath":"/rest/api-docs","resourcePath":"/resttwocustomer","apis":[{"path":"/resttwocustomer/customers/{id}/","operations":[{"method":"GET","summary":"Find Customer by ID","notes":"More notes about this method","type":"org.jboss.quickstarts.fuse.rest.Customer","nickname":"getCustomer","produces":["application/xml"],"authorizations":{},"parameters":[{"name":"id","description":"ID of Customer to fetch","required":true,"type":"string","paramType":"path"}],"responseMessages":[{"code":500,"message":"Invalid ID supplied"},{"code":204,"message":"Customer not found"}]}]}]}

Freeman(Yue) Fang I assume that there is no need to replace JARs in system directory when R3 patch is applied. I did following steps:

features:install cxf-jaxrs; features:install swagger
 
install -s file:/home/trohovsk/Downloads/rest_prj/target/rest.jar
 
install -s file:/home/trohovsk/Downloads/rest2_prj/target/rest2.jar

with this result for each installation:

Adding of swagger to featuresBoot property did't help. Swagger doesn't appear to be installed afterwards - I got empty output after hitting list -t 0 | grep -i swagger. I got

Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs.json.JacksonJsonProvider not found by com.foo.quickstarts.fuse.rest [251]

if I install only cxf-jaxrs features before rest_proj. If I install both cxf-jaxrs and swagger features, I get the same exception as in my previous comment.

I tried that again on freshly installed Fuse 6.1 with R3 applied and it worked. Shouldn't R3 patch also modify etc/org.apache.karaf.features.cfg by adding swagger to featuresBoot to prevent the exception?

Yes, it works after refreshing of cxf-rt-frontend-jaxrs on patched 6.1.

JBossFuse:karaf@root> list -t 0 | grep "CXF Runtime JAX-RS Frontend"
 
[ 175] [Active     ] [Created     ] [       ] [   40] Apache CXF Runtime JAX-RS Frontend (2.7.0.redhat-611444)
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> refresh 175

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. Install Fuse 6.1.0 GA and start it
2. features:install cxf-jaxrs; features:install swagger
2. Stop Fuse and install the test JARs from bugs ENTESB-3005 and ENTESB-2411. There are three JARs to install in total, and instructions are in the bug reports (essentially, overwrite the original JARs in the system/ folder)
3. rm -rf data/
4. Restart Fuse
5. Build and deploy the code in rest_prj.zip (target/rest.jar)
6. Build and deploy the code in rest2_prj.zip (target/rest2_prj.jar)
7. Request http://localhost:8181/cxf/rest2/api-docs/resttwocustomer
8. Request http://localhost:8181/cxf/rest/api-docs/restcustomer

Note that the "models" section appears only in the first request. Restarting Fuse and reversing steps 7 and 8 will still show a "models" section in the first request. Note also that the basePath entry is the same in both requests, and probably it should not be.
